intro: Dicrocaulon microstigma, commonly known as the small-stigma dicrocaulon, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Dicrocaulon microstigma is often found in wetlands and is adapted to tolerate periodic flooding.
